data.title: The Tuberous Sclerosis Association
data.meta_description:
Find a local NHS TSC clinic  
Information and contact details for NHS TSC clinics across the UK    
There are NHS TSC clinics across the UK, with specialist clinicians and researchers in each who understand the impact that living with TSC can have on individuals and families.
NHS TSC clinics
data.text:
Type of clinic: Children only

Location: Liverpool

Address: Paediatric Neurodisability, Alder Hey Children’s NHS Foundation Trust, Eaton Road, Liverpool, L12 2AP

Clinic lead: Dr Zahabiyah Bassi

Referral pathway: Referrals from Consultant Paediatrician responsible for care of the child with TSC preferred. Also accept referrals from other clinicians and GP, but should ensure local paediatrician is aware of the referral or could be rejected. Online referrals preferred (click here for form). Also accept clinical letters to Dr Bassi.

Email: commpaedsqueries@alderhey.nhs.uk

Tel: 0151 252 5972 / 0151 282 4930, Ext 4100

Website: Click here

The TSC clinic is held every month and is jointly run by a neurodevelopmental paediatrician, with expertise in: Neurodisability, Paediatric Neurologist, Paediatric Nephrologist, Clinical Psychologist. A Physician Associate is also in attendance, who is the care coordinator for the TSC service.

Type of clinic: Adults and children

Location: Nottingham

Address: Department of Clinical Genetics, City Hospital Campus, The Gables, Gate 3, Hucknall Road, Nottingham, NG5 1PB

Clinic lead: Dr Jaqueline Eason (Consultant in Clinical Genetics). Dr Rana Mohamed, Paediatric Neurologist at Queen’s Medical Centre (Nottingham University Hospitals) is working in partnership with the genetic team. Referrals may be directed to Dr Mohamed if appropriate.

Referral: Written referral to Dr Jacqueline Eason from any health professional

Contact: Janine Bowes (Genetic Counsellor)

Tel: 0115 962 7728

Email: nuhnt.clinicalgenetics@nhs.net

Website: Click here

Type of clinic: Adults and children

Location: Cornwall

Address: Truro is an outreach clinic held by the local learning disability team in Threemilestone

Clinic leads: Prof Finbar O’Callaghan and Dr Ron Loh

Referral pathway: All referrals and correspondence come via the Bath TSC clinic. E-referrals for local referrals, or letter by the GP or any medical specialist

Tel: 01225 821 545

Email: charlottereed1@nhs.net

Referral: GP or any specialist involved in the person’s care can refer. E-referral for local referrals or by letter. Referrals should be made out to Bath clinic address.

Held by local learning disability team in Threemilestone (Prioritise patients with LD who may be less able to travel to Bath).

Type of clinic: Adults and children

Location: Cardiff

Address: All Wales Medical Genomics Service (AWMGS), Institute of Medical Genetics, Cardiff and Vale UHB, Heath Park, Cardiff, CF14 4XW

Clinic lead: Dr Jennifer Gardner (Consultant Clinical Geneticist)

Referral pathway: Via GP or other specialist to Dr Jenny Gardner

Contact: Karen Bailey (TSC Clinical Nurse Specialist)

Email: se.genetics@wales.nhs.uk

Tel: 02921 847451

Website: Click here

Please note: The phone numbers noted on the ‘contact us’ section of the website are for Swansea, Cardiff and North Wales. The clinic is currently looking into organising a generic email address for the service, which will be updated as soon as more details are received.
